definition: ample scope for abilities/favorable position for the use of one's skills (idiom)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
surname Wu
martial/military
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

sentences.english: Take out your true skill, to the ground that you use violence.
sentences.chinese: 拿出你的真本事，给你用武之地。

sentences.english: Yellow and White Party Skills now have animations.
sentences.chinese: 黄法和白法的组队技能现在有了用武之地。

sentences.english: The career principles in the books are also of limited use.
sentences.chinese: 此外，书中所说的职场原则也鲜少有用武之地。

sentences.english: And this is where middleware comes in.
sentences.chinese: 这正是中间件的用武之地。

sentences.english: Sports and recreational activities make good use of this tape as well.
sentences.chinese: 运动和娱乐活动也是这种带子的用武之地。

sentences.english: But there is a better way to put these surplus countries' high saving rates to use.
sentences.chinese: 但盈余国的高储蓄率有更好的用武之地。

sentences.english: Other gestures have potential as well.
sentences.chinese: 其他的手势也可能有用武之地。

sentences.english: This is where custom finder helpers come in.
sentences.chinese: 这就是定制查找器助手的用武之地。
但是秃鹫也有自己的用武之地。

sentences.english: This is where hot deployment and hot update come in.
sentences.chinese: 而这就是热部署和热更新的用武之地。

sentences.english: It is in the latter circumstance that the Mirror Image pattern comes into play.
sentences.chinese: 镜像映象模式的用武之地是后一种情况。

sentences.english: Bombs and bullets will always have their place, of course.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹和子弹当然一直会有用武之地。

definition: to put to good use/to come in handy
usefulness/CL:個|个[ge4]
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

definition: (idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
skill/ability/capability/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to lean on/to rely on
use/application/Taiwan pr. [yong4 chang2]
it may be said
to count on/to rely on
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to put sb in powerful position/to empower
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.
pinyin: qiao3 fu4 nan2 wei2 wu2 mi3 zhi1 chui1

definition: to make a contribution/to establish/to found/contribution
ready-made/readily available
to showcase one's (unique) talents/to display one's (individual) prowess
